title: Office for Mac: Font style linking
content:
Before someone starts sending me to these threads  
— [Does anyone still use merged/harmonized Postscript fonts?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180832/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17809)  
— [Harmonizing font names on MS Word Mac/Windows](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180832/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17086)  
— [Faux bold/italic substitution](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180832/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17405)  
— [Style Linked and seperate fonts?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180832/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17636)  
I would like to say I read them all.

I’m trying to troubleshoot a 4-member (Regular, Italic, Bold, BoldItalic) OTF-CFF (.otf) font family in Office for Mac applications (v11.2). The family works fine –naming and style linking– after I do a font cache cleaning. However, if I reboot after that, style linking stops working.

I noticed the same behaviour with Adobe’s Pro fonts –Warnock Pro (v1.9), for example.

Does anyone have any insights on this issue? Thanks.

 [‹ How does ZapfDingbats.dfont work?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180832/http:/typophile.com/node/17944 "Go to previous forum topic") [Fontographer for windows? Help??? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180832/http:/typophile.com/node/17936 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Miguel Sousa

comments.content: I have run into this problem myself. It seems to affect applications which are not OT-aware. Deactivating and reactivating the fonts seems to fix it. Seems to be a bug in OS X.
Miguel, as this doesn’t seem to be Word specific I won’t forward it to them. If you feel otherwise let me know. Still not heard back on the ’ding’ bug - I’ll chase that up.
